org.apache.hadoop.net.unix

Class DomainSocketWatcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hadoop.net.unix.DomainSocketWatcher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable

    @InterfaceAudience.LimitedPrivate(value="HDFS")
public final class DomainSocketWatcher
extends Object
implements Closeable
    The DomainSocketWatcher watches a set of domain sockets to see when they become readable, or closed. When one of those events happens, it makes a callback. See DomainSocket for more information about UNIX domain sockets.

    • Nested Class Summary

      private static class  DomainSocketWatcher.FdSet

      Handler for {DomainSocketWatcher#notificationSockets[1]}

      • LOG

        static org.apache.commons.logging.Log LOG

      • loadingFailureReason

        private static final String loadingFailureReason
        The reason why DomainSocketWatcher is not available, or null if it is available.

      • lock

        private final ReentrantLock lock
        Lock which protects toAdd, toRemove, and closed.

      • processedCond

        private final Condition processedCond
        Condition variable which indicates that toAdd and toRemove have been processed.

      • toAdd

        private final LinkedList<DomainSocketWatcher.Entry> toAdd
        Entries to add.

      • toRemove

        private final TreeMap<Integer,DomainSocket> toRemove
        Entries to remove.

      • interruptCheckPeriodMs

        private final int interruptCheckPeriodMs
        Maximum length of time to go between checking whether the interrupted bit has been set for this thread.

      • notificationSockets

        private final DomainSocket[] notificationSockets
        A pair of sockets used to wake up the thread after it has called poll(2).

      • closed

        private boolean closed
        Whether or not this DomainSocketWatcher is closed.

      • kicked

        private boolean kicked
        True if we have written a byte to the notification socket. We should not write anything else to the socket until the notification handler has had a chance to run. Otherwise, our thread might block, causing deadlock. See HADOOP-11333 for details.

      • watcherThread

        final Thread watcherThread

        private static void anchorNative()
        Initializes the native library code.

      • getLoadingFailureReason

        public static String getLoadingFailureReason()

      • close

        public void close()
           throws IOException
        Close the DomainSocketWatcher and wait for its thread to terminate. If there is more than one close, all but the first will be ignored.
        Specified by:
        close in interface Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        IOException

      • isClosed

        public boolean isClosed()

      • add

        public void add(DomainSocket sock,
       DomainSocketWatcher.Handler handler)
        Add a socket.
        Parameters:
        sock - The socket to add. It is an error to re-add a socket that we are already watching.
        handler - The handler to associate with this socket. This may be called any time after this function is called.

      • remove

        public void remove(DomainSocket sock)
        Remove a socket. Its handler will be called.
        Parameters:
        sock - The socket to remove.

      • kick

        private void kick()
        Wake up the DomainSocketWatcher thread.

      • sendCallback

        private boolean sendCallback(String caller,
                   TreeMap<Integer,DomainSocketWatcher.Entry> entries,
                   DomainSocketWatcher.FdSet fdSet,
                   int fd)
        Send callback and return whether or not the domain socket was closed as a result of processing.
        Parameters:
        caller - reason for call
        entries - mapping of file descriptor to entry
        fdSet - set of file descriptors
        fd - file descriptor
        Returns:
        true if the domain socket was closed as a result of processing

      • sendCallbackAndRemove

        private void sendCallbackAndRemove(String caller,
                         TreeMap<Integer,DomainSocketWatcher.Entry> entries,
                         DomainSocketWatcher.FdSet fdSet,
                         int fd)
        Send callback, and if the domain socket was closed as a result of processing, then also remove the entry for the file descriptor.
        Parameters:
        caller - reason for call
        entries - mapping of file descriptor to entry
        fdSet - set of file descriptors
        fd - file descriptor
